doc.after: Some conventional destroyers were completed in the late 1940s and 1950s which built on wartime experience. These vessels were significantly larger than wartime ships and had fully automatic main guns, unit Machinery, radar, sonar, and antisubmarine weapons such as the Squid mortar. Examples include the British DaringÂ class, US Forrest ShermanÂ class, and the Soviet Kotlin-class destroyers.
